pr_title: Fix bitmasking / bitshifting code to encode / decode user data

timeline.message:
Fix bitmasking / bitshifting code to encode / decode user data

Motivation:

Our bitmasking / shifting did not correctly handle negative values.

Modifications:

- Change methods to allow passing user data
- fix bitmasking / bitshifting code
- Add unit test

Result:

Be able to pass in negative values as well

Fix bitmasking / bitshifting code to encode / decode user data

Motivation:

Our bitmasking / shifting did not correctly handle negative values.

Modifications:

- Change methods to allow passing user data
- fix bitmasking / bitshifting code
- Add unit test

Result:

Be able to pass in negative values as well

timeline.bodyText: It looks a bit weird that the data section is the lower bits, plus the sign bit. How is the sign bit not also included in the op value here? Maybe it's clearer to place the op in the lower bits, and data in the upper bits.
timeline.author: chrisvest

replies.bodyText: sorry not sure I follow... Can you show me how you would change this ?
replies.author: normanmaurer
chrisvest

replies.bodyText: @chrisvest makes sense... Let me apply this one .
replies.author: normanmaurer

replies.bodyText: return (long) data << 48 | (long) op << 32 | fd; @chrisvest why is data a short? :)
replies.author: 1Jo1

replies.bodyText: @1Jo1 because a short is all we can store in there... we only have 2 bytes.
replies.author: normanmaurer

replies.bodyText: it's a bit confusing, as the data is actually a int
replies.author: 1Jo1

replies.bodyText: its an int just to make it easier to pass around (but as you may have noticed we have an assert in there to ensure it is never bigger than a short). Otherwise you will need to always add (short)  when passing it around
replies.author: normanmaurer

replies.bodyText: ok, I would suggest to change data type parameter to short, it would make more sense and more readable
replies.author: 1Jo1
njhill

timeline.bodyText: If encoding and decoding were package-private static methods, ideally placed next to each other in some utility class, the code might be cleaner and we could simplify this test a bit.
timeline.author: chrisvest

timeline.bodyText: Oops, we also need a line break here.
timeline.author: chrisvest

replies.bodyText: yep... will do this as part of switching to short
replies.author: normanmaurer
